Location Southern Victoria Land, Ross Dependency, Antarctica.

The region surrounding the Mackay Glacier has provided refugia for springtail populations during glacial maxima and remains an area of high genetic and species diversity for Collembola within the Ross Sea region.

Small oases of ice-free ground existed around the edge of the polar cap, the largest of which (the Dry Valleys) is still located within the Transantarctic Mountain on the western edge of the Ross Ice Shelf (Clapperton & Sugden, 1990).
Since then, the East Antarctic Ice Sheet (EAIS) has undergone numerous glacial cycles, with the last glacial maximum ending 17 Kya (Suggate, 1990).
Ten species of springtail are currently known from the Ross Dependency, four in northern Victoria Land, three in southern Victoria Land and three in the southern Transantarctic Mountains.

Methods Study sites and sample collection: Samples were collected from St John's Ranges near Victoria Valley and on the northern and southern sides of the Mackay Glacier in the northern Dry Valleys region of the Ross Dependency (Fig. 1).

At the University of 132 133 134 135 136 137 138 139 140 14] 142 143 144 145 146 147 148 149 150 151 152 153 154 155 156 Waikato total genomic DNA was extracted from the tissue of entire specimens using a Glassfiber Plate DNA Extraction (AcroPrep) method (Ivanova et al., 2006) at CCDB, and Red Extract n Amp (Sigma-Aldrich) using 10 ul extraction solution and 2.5 ul tissue prep, following manufactureâ€™s protocol.
The 2-step link to haplotypes at Mt England was also supported by divergence values and phylogenetic trees.
The difference between haplotypes from Mt Gran and Mt Seuss relative to those at Mt England is much more recent by comparison, estimated at 0.38 Mya.

The species diversity of mites, lichens and mosses have also been shown to be high in the Mackay Glacier region relative to other nearby areas such as the Dry Valleys (Demetras et al., 2010; Green et al., 2011).

Dispersal events in Antarctica are likely to be rare, and often accidental, making it difficult to attribute the presence of a species to ecological gradients (Janetschek, 1967b; Magalhaes et al., 2012).
This appears to have isolated the Mt Gran population of G. hodgsoni from the populations on Mt Seuss in the centre of the glacier, and those in the St John's Range bordering Victoria Valley.
It 1s possible that the presence of haplotypes from the St John's range in the Mt Seuss population relate to recent dispersal since the last glacial maximum.
The stochastic nature of dispersal events in Antarctica may explain why G. hodgsoni has yet to disperse from the Mt Gran population.
The isolation of these sites highlights the potential for high genetic diversity to be maintained on a small scale among the fragmented ice-free areas of Antarctica.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: Since then, the East Antarctic Ice Sheet (EAIS) has undergone numerous glacial cycles, with the last glacial maximum ending 17 Kya (Suggate, 1990).

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: Ten species of springtail are currently known from the Ross Dependency, four in northern Victoria Land, three in southern Victoria Land and three in the southern Transantarctic Mountains.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: Methods Study sites and sample collection: Samples were collected from St John's Ranges near Victoria Valley and on the northern and southern sides of the Mackay Glacier in the northern Dry Valleys region of the Ross Dependency (Fig. 1).

Sentence_location: At the University of 132 133 134 135 136 137 138 139 140 14] 142 143 144 145 146 147 148 149 150 151 152 153 154 155 156 Waikato total genomic DNA was extracted from the tissue of entire specimens using a Glassfiber Plate DNA Extraction (AcroPrep) method (Ivanova et al., 2006) at CCDB, and Red Extract n Amp (Sigma-Aldrich) using 10 ul extraction solution and 2.5 ul tissue prep, following manufactureâ€™s protocol.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: The 2-step link to haplotypes at Mt England was also supported by divergence values and phylogenetic trees.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: The difference between haplotypes from Mt Gran and Mt Seuss relative to those at Mt England is much more recent by comparison, estimated at 0.38 Mya.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: The species diversity of mites, lichens and mosses have also been shown to be high in the Mackay Glacier region relative to other nearby areas such as the Dry Valleys (Demetras et al., 2010; Green et al., 2011).

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: Dispersal events in Antarctica are likely to be rare, and often accidental, making it difficult to attribute the presence of a species to ecological gradients (Janetschek, 1967b; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: This appears to have isolated the Mt Gran population of G. hodgsoni from the populations on Mt Seuss in the centre of the glacier, and those in the St John's Range bordering Victoria Valley.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: It 1s possible that the presence of haplotypes from the St John's range in the Mt Seuss population relate to recent dispersal since the last glacial maximum.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: The stochastic nature of dispersal events in Antarctica may explain why G. hodgsoni has yet to disperse from the Mt Gran population.

Sentence_species: ANTSP154 ANTSP157 ANTSP158 ANTSP159 ANTSP160 ANTSP163 ANTSP164 ANTSP165 ANTSP168 ANTSP169 ANTSP172 ANTSP174 ANTSP175 ANTSP220 ANTSP222 ANTSP221 ANTSP223 ANTSP224 ANTSP152 ANTSP225 ANTSP162 ANTSP173 534 G14 G15 G16 C. nivicolus Nl N2 N3 N4 N5 N6 N7 N8 N9 N10 N11 N12 A. monoculata Al A2 Mt Gran Springtail Point Mt Gran 77.034 161.731 -76.966 161.179 -77.167
Sentence_location: The isolation of these sites highlights the potential for high genetic diversity to be maintained on a small scale among the fragmented ice-free areas of Antarctica.

Sentence_location: Since then, the East Antarctic Ice Sheet (EAIS) has undergone numerous glacial cycles, with the last glacial maximum ending 17 Kya (Suggate, 1990).

Sentence_location: Ten species of springtail are currently known from the Ross Dependency, four in northern Victoria Land, three in southern Victoria Land and three in the southern Transantarctic Mountains.

Sentence_location: Methods Study sites and sample collection: Samples were collected from St John's Ranges near Victoria Valley and on the northern and southern sides of the Mackay Glacier in the northern Dry Valleys region of the Ross Dependency (Fig. 1).

Sentence_location: The difference between haplotypes from Mt Gran and Mt Seuss relative to those at Mt England is much more recent by comparison, estimated at 0.38 Mya.

Sentence_location: The species diversity of mites, lichens and mosses have also been shown to be high in the Mackay Glacier region relative to other nearby areas such as the Dry Valleys (Demetras et al., 2010; Green et al., 2011).

Sentence_location: Dispersal events in Antarctica are likely to be rare, and often accidental, making it difficult to attribute the presence of a species to ecological gradients (Janetschek, 1967b; Magalhaes et al., 2012).

Sentence_location: This appears to have isolated the Mt Gran population of G. hodgsoni from the populations on Mt Seuss in the centre of the glacier, and those in the St John's Range bordering Victoria Valley.

Sentence_location: It 1s possible that the presence of haplotypes from the St John's range in the Mt Seuss population relate to recent dispersal since the last glacial maximum.

Sentence_location: The stochastic nature of dispersal events in Antarctica may explain why G. hodgsoni has yet to disperse from the Mt Gran population.
